com.google.gwt.gears.client.database
Class ResultSet

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      com.google.gwt.gears.client.database.ResultSet

public final class ResultSet
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject

Represents the results of executing an SQL statement. A ResultSet must have its close() called once it is no longer needed. The ResultSet class provides methods for getting fields as a particular type, getFieldAdByte, getFieldAdChar, etc. These getter methods will attempt to convert the field value into the requested type, but the overflow behavior is undefined.

Constructor Detail

ResultSet

protected ResultSet()
Method Detail

close

public void close()
           throws DatabaseException
Releases the state associated with this ResultSet. You are required to call close() when you are finished with any ResultSet. Note: there is currently a feature request against the JavaScript API to have close called automatically when the result set goes out of scope.

Throws:
DatabaseException - on any error

isValidRow

public boolean isValidRow()
Returns true if this ResultSet cursor is currently pointing at a valid row. Typically used to iterate over rows in the ResultSet.

Returns:
true if there is a valid row containing data, false otherwise

next

public void next()
Advances to the next row of the results.
